intro: Phalaenopsis maculata, commonly known as the spotted moth orchid, is a tropical epiphytic orchid native to Southeast Asia. It features long, arching inflorescences with clustered, showy flowers that are typically white or pale pink with distinctive dark markings. The plant has broad,革质 (leathery) leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern, aiding in water retention. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires moderate humidity and well-draining potting media. Phalaenopsis maculata is popular as a houseplant due to its attractive appearance and ability to bloom repeatedly over several years.
